server

Class CentralSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.CentralSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IContext

    public class CentralSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements IContext
    CentralSystem is the main part of the system, receiving incoming connections, holding the data and answering to requests

    A CentralSystem instance is characterized by the following :

    • 4 final port values for: Test, Boat, User and Admin connections
    • A list of TCPServers
    • A list of administrators
    • A list of subscribers
    • A list of boats
    • A list of trusted persons
    • A set of observers
    • An SQLHandler
    Author:
    Quentin Ducasse
    See Also:
    IContext

                     java.util.List<Boat> boatList,

        CentralSystem Constructor.

        Through construction, the system is initialized with the given lists and starts the 4 servers

        Parameters:
        subscriberList - The list of subscriber
        boatList - The list of boats
        administratorList - The list of administrators
